alert.note: Alert for Columbia (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 16 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Columbia County, Webster, northwestern De Soto, northwestern Red River, southern Caddo, northwestern Claiborne, west central Bienville and Bossier Parishes through 1100 PM CDT... At 1029 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Plain Dealing to 7 miles west of Stonewall. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Shreveport, Bossier City, Minden, Springhill, Haughton, Haynesville, Benton, Stonewall, Sibley, Cullen, Cotton Valley, Sarepta, Doyline, Dixie Inn, Dubberly, Heflin, Shongaloo, Eastwood, Atlanta and Fosters. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for southwestern Arkansas...and northwestern Louisiana.
